newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai govt oil firm enters LPG business in Vietnam.
newsitem.headline: Thai govt oil firm enters LPG business in Vietnam.

text.p: State-run Petroleum Authority of Thailand (PTT) said it has entered into the liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) business in Vietnam through a joint venture which opened its first LPG storage and filling plant there on Tuesday.
Vietnam LPG Co Ltd, a joint venture of PTT, PetroVietnam Gas and Total Outre Mer of France, invested $5.2 million on construction of the plant in Dong Nai province, south of Ho Chi Minh City.
The plant has a storage capacity of 800 tonnes. The plant will bottle LPG from Thailand and distribute to customers in the central and southern parts of Vietnam.
LPG demand in Vietnam is projected to grow at the rate of 30-40 percent in the next 5 years.
PTT holds a 32 percent stake in Vietnam LPG while PetroVietnam Gas holds 36 percent and Total Outre Mer holds 32 percent, the statement said.
